# What is .pink[Democratic Backsliding?]

--

<br>

> ## [T]he .Blue[incremental] erosion of democratic institutions, rules and norms that results from the actions of .green[duly elected governments], typically driven by an autocratic leader. .black[.small[(Haggard & Kaufman 2020, 1)]]

--

## - Democratic Backsliding $\subset$ Autocratization .tiny[(.red[any] movement away from democracy)]

---

# Global Backsliding .tiny[(Autocratization)] Trend (V-dem data)

--

```{r, fig.width=14.5, fig.height=7, fig.align='center'}

library(ERT)


data <- get_eps() %>%
  select(c("country_name", "year",
         "v2x_polyarchy", "v2x_regime", "reg_type",
         "aut_ep", "aut_ep_subreg")) %>%
  filter(year>1944)


data %>%
  ggplot(aes(x=year)) +
  geom_bar(aes(fill=factor(aut_ep)), 
           stat = 'count',
           alpha=0.75) +
  labs(fill = "autocratization") +
  theme_minimal() + 
  scale_fill_manual(labels = c("No", "Yes"),
                    values = c("blue", "red")) +
  theme(text = element_text(size = 25))
```

---

# Global Backsliding .tiny[(Autocratization)] Trend (V-dem data): .green[**zoom-in**]

```{r, fig.width=14, fig.height=7, fig.align='center'}

data %>%
  filter(aut_ep == 1) %>%
  ggplot(aes(x=year,
             fill=factor(aut_ep_subreg))) +
  geom_bar() +
  theme_minimal() +
  scale_fill_manual(values = c("red", "blue"),
                    labels = c("No", "Yes")) +
  labs(fill = "breakdown, eventually?") +
  theme(text = element_text(size = 25))

```
